intro: Licaria cufodontisii, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
